title: Julius Baer to Pay $5 Million After Swiss Money Laundering Probe

title: PBOC Flips Script on Curbing Yuan Weakness to Slowing Rally
content: In a few short weeks, China has gone from leaning in to prevent a rapid weakening in the yuan to a situation where some traders see it moving to slow down a rally.

title: No Going Back to Normal After Trump Tariffs: Sorrell
content:
S4 Capital Founder, Martin Sorrell, says there's no going back to normal after President Trump's tariff war. That's despite the 90-day truce between the US and China.
He told Bloomberg's Insight with Haslinda Amin how his clients are positioning amid heightened uncertainty. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Jordan: Word is Out Saudi Arabia is Open For Business
content: US President Donald Trump and Saudi Crown Prince, Mohammed bin Salman, announced a pledge for $1 trillion in commercial deals at their summit in Riyadh during the President's tour of the Middle East. The White House later said the investments so far are worth $600 billion as the President travels to Qatar today to continue his first official state visit. Robert W. Jordan, Former US Ambassador to Saudi Arabia told Bloomberg's Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche on the deals but also the geopolitical announcements from the visit. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin  5/14/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Favors $40-$50 Oil, Goldman Says After Sifting Posts
content: President Donald Trump appears to prefer US oil prices between $40 and $50 a barrel, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc., citing an in-house analysis of his social-media posts on the topic.

title: Top South African Transport Firm, Union in Talks to Avoid Strike
content: The biggest labor union at South Africa’s state-owned port and rail company are starting final talks with a third-party arbitrator to resolve a wage dispute and stave off a potential strike by thousands of workers.

title: CATL Guides IPO Price at Top End in World's Biggest Listing of 2025
content: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. is poised to raise at least $4 billion in its Hong Kong share listing after planning to price it at the top end it had earlier indicated, according to people familiar with the matter, thanks to strong demand for the stock.

title: Thai Central Bank Tempers Rate Cut Bets as Trade Shocks Linger
content: Thailand’s central bank tamped down on expectations of more rate cuts to deal with a worsening growth outlook, with officials saying they need to preserve the limited policy space to guard against future shocks stemming from a global trade war.

title: Gold Drops as Traders Reassess Need for Havens After Trade Truce
content: Gold fell for the second time in three days as cooling trade tensions between the US and China drove a reallocation away from havens.

title: Asian Stocks Gain Before Chinese Tech Earnings: Markets Wrap
content: Asia’s benchmark stock index rose, led by the tech sector, as investors awaited earnings from some of the largest Chinese technology firms this week.

title: FTSE 100 Live: Burberry Shares Jump, UK Stocks Dip Again
German Bank PBB Reviews US Business Citing Political Instability
content: German real estate lender Deutsche Pfandbriefbank AG said it has put its US business under review as a result of the country’s lack of political stability.

title: Chinese Companies Turn to Bank Loans Amid Market Turmoil
content: Chinese companies are favoring bank loans as an alternate source of funding, as they seek to lower costs amid market uncertainty.

title: CSI Properties Sells Its First Dollar Bond in Four Years
content: CSI Properties Ltd. sold its first dollar bond in four years, a move that could potentially ease liquidity concerns for the builder amid a prolonged real estate slump in Hong Kong and China.

title: ABN Amro Profit Beats Expectations on Cost Control, Fee Income
content: ABN Amro Bank NV reported first-quarter profit that beat expectations, as cost control and higher fees helped the Dutch lender offset the effect of declining interest rates.

title: Oil Holds Four-Day Gain Spurred by Trade Optimism, Iran Remarks
content: Oil held the bulk of its biggest four-day rally since October, spurred by the US-China trade détente and President Donald Trump’s increasingly hostile rhetoric on Iranian supply,

title: Where Were You in ’82? This Rally Is There Again
content: Animal spirits are trampling any lingering inflation or tariff doubts.

title: Reiss: Trump Not Following a Traditional US Foreign Policy
content: President Donald Trump begins his Middle East visit that's set to include Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, and Qatar where he is expected to reinforce the nation's security interests and push for more investment from the region. Mitchell Reiss, Distinguished Fellow at Royal United Services Institute & former US Special Envoy for Northern Ireland spoke to Bloomberg’s David Ingles on Horizons Middle East and Africa about the difference in the administration’s focus. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Fortress, Kimmeridge Open Abu Dhabi Outposts to Hunt for Deals
content: Fortress Investment Group and energy-focused private equity firm Kimmeridge are opening Abu Dhabi offices, aiming to make deals and boost assets by leaning on their ties to sovereign wealth fund Mubadala Investment Co.

title: Zimbabwe to Get First Dollar-Listed REIT as Property Gains Favor
content: Zimbabwe will get its first dollar-denominated real estate investment listing this week, as demand for property stocks grow.

content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and Annabelle Droulers give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Sony Sees $700 Million Tariff Hit on Underwhelming Outlook
content: Sony Group Corp. offered an underwhelming forecast for the year ahead, with the burden of US tariffs wiping out expectations for an increase in operating profit.

title: India’s RBI Reviews Some E-Wallets After Taxi App Goes Bust
content: India’s central bank is scrutinizing some digital wallets associated with electric-vehicle players after the sudden collapse of the country’s largest all-EV taxi service left users unable to access money tied to their accounts, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Foreigners Sell Indian Shares After Longest Buying Streak Since 2023
content: Foreigners turned sellers of Indian shares after purchasing more than $6 billion in 16 consecutive days — their longest buying streak in two years.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 05/14/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Nissan Shares Fall on Annual Loss, Withheld Profit Outlook
content: Nissan Motor Co. shares fell after the Japanese automaker posted an annual net loss of ¥670.9 billion ($4.5 billion) and decided against issuing an operating profit forecast for the current fiscal year.

title: Australia’s Queensland to Issue More Euro Debt After Strong Sale
content: Australia’s Queensland state intends to issue more euro-denominated debt after it garnered strong demand for its first-ever benchmark issuance in the currency as it taps offshore markets to broaden the investor base.

title: Tencent, Alibaba Results Key to Cementing China Tech Stock Rally
content: Earnings from the two biggest names in China tech are the next big watchpoint for clues on whether one of 2025’s hottest stock rallies is back on track.

title: China Tech Now 'Attractive': UBS' Yifan Hu
content: UBS Global Wealth Management CIO Yifan Hu says China's tech sector is now considered "attractive" at a time when more clients are interested in diversifying away from dollar assets. Hu speaks on Bloomberg's The China Show. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Macron Calls for More Pressure on Israel Over Gaza
content: French President Emmanuel Macron urged the European Union to step up pressure on Israel over the humanitarian situation in Gaza.

title: Orban Seeks to Cut Funding to Hungary’s Independent NGOs, Media
content: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s party wants to choke off domestic funding to independent civil society organizations, in an increasingly aggressive crackdown that critics say is aimed at stopping a surging opposition less than a year before elections.

title: In Trump’s World, Jets Are Key to Unlocking Political Favors
content: President Donald Trump’s long-held fascination with the world of aviation is proving a useful tool for governments and companies seeking to win his favor.

title: Lula Says Brazil Unafraid of US Retaliation Over China Ties
content: Brazil’s President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva brushed off concern that the Trump administration would punish his country for building closer ties with China, after a state visit to Beijing that saw him sign more than 30 agreements.

title: Merz Risks Coalition Spat With Call to Scrap EU Supply-Chain Law
content: Germany’s new chancellor, Friedrich Merz, reiterated a call for the European Union to scrap rules designed to make companies pursue sustainable policies in their supply chains, doubling down on a position that risks igniting conflict with his Social Democrat coalition partners.

title: Trump Officials Resist Sharing How Migrants Were Tagged as Gangsters
content: The Trump administration doesn’t want to reveal just how it determined that some Venezuelans in the New York City area who it’s seeking to deport are members of the Tren de Aragua gang.

title: How Australia’s Housing Market Became So Out of Reach
content: Ballooning property prices and rents are causing serious housing affordability problems in Australia. So how bad is it? And how did it get to this point?

title: Seven Days Will Decide If Britain’s Borders Are Open or Closed
content: The UK government’s paranoia about immigration must not derail the EU reset.

title: NATO Is Sketching Out Plan to Meet Trump Call for 5% of GDP on Defense
content: NATO allies have started cobbling together an agreement to significantly boost defense spending in a way that may assuage US President Donald Trump’s demand to spend 5% of economic output on the military.

title: Hong Kong Rushes to Beef Up Security Law, Cementing China’s Grip
content: Hong Kong fast-tracked new national security rules that further consolidate Beijing’s control over the financial hub, with the changes taking effect immediately.

title: Wall Street Sees Higher China Growth, Less Stimulus on US Truce
content: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and other major banks boosted their forecasts for China’s 2025 economic growth, citing a better outlook for exports following the tariff truce with the US.

title: US Warns of Missile Threats That Trump’s Golden Dome May Face
content: China may within a decade possess scores of orbiting missiles with nuclear payloads capable of reaching the US with much shorter flight times than traditional intercontinental ballistic missiles, the Defense Intelligence Agency said Tuesday.

title: Bolivia President Arce Declines Candidacy, Calls for Left-Wing Unity
content: Bolivia’s President Luis Arce dropped his pursuit of reelection, calling for candidate Andronico Rodriguez to unite leftists ahead of the August vote and fend off a challenge from the right.

title: China Has ‘Price to Pay’ on Fentanyl Issue, Former US Envoy Says
content: The US has made it clear to China that failing to coordinate on the fentanyl issue comes at a cost, according to Nicholas Burns, American’s former ambassador to Beijing.

title: Peru Prime Minister Resigns After Backlash From Cabinet Reshuffle
content: Peru’s prime minister resigned on Tuesday evening after a last-ditch attempt at a cabinet reshuffle did not placate opposition lawmakers who demanded his ouster.

title: Ecuador to Charge Correa’s Former VP in Candidate’s Murder
content: Ecuador’s Prosecutor General’s Office is preparing to charge former Vice President Jorge Glas and four other men for allegedly having planned the 2023 assassination of presidential candidate Fernando Villavicencio, according to social media reports that Glas’ lawyer confirmed as accurate.

title: China Surrounded Xi’s Aide With Seasoned Experts to Seal US Deal
content: China’s surprisingly quick agreement with the US to wind back punitive tariff rates put a spotlight on a Chinese negotiating team that features decades worth of technical trade experience alongside a top aide of President Xi Jinping.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Will Lower California’s Revenue by $16 Billion
content: President Donald Trump’s tariff policies are projected to cut California’s tax revenue by $16 billion in the next fiscal year, Governor Gavin Newsom’s finance department said in a memo.

title: Northwestern Investigated by US for Discrimination Against Jews
content: Northwestern University is facing a probe by the US Department of Health and Human Services for alleged civil rights violations against Jewish students, an investigation that could lead to further restrictions on federal funding to the school.

title: Trump Says Gifted Qatari Plane Will Be Temporary Air Force One
content: President Donald Trump said a luxury jet being offered by the government of Qatar would be used as a temporary Air Force One, indicating an intention to accept a gift that has sparked ethical and security concerns in Washington.

title: Carney Says He’s Open to Changing Green Laws to Boost Energy Projects
content: Prime Minister Mark Carney said he’ll consider altering environmental regulations passed by his predecessor, Justin Trudeau, in order to facilitate investment in major projects in Canada, including oil and gas pipelines.

title: Republicans Could Reach SALT Compromise Wednesday, Johnson Says
content: House Republicans could land on a compromise on the state and local tax deduction on Wednesday, a deal that would represent a breakthrough in one of the thorniest policy debates in President Donald Trump’s economic package.

title: Harvard Expands Lawsuit Against US as Funding Feud Deepens
content: Harvard University expanded its lawsuit Tuesday against the Trump administration for freezing billions of dollars in federal funds, ratcheting up the high-stakes legal battle between the wealthiest US university and the White House.

title: California, New York Sue US Over Funds Tied to Immigration
content: California, New York and 18 other states sued the Trump administration, claiming it illegally conditioned billions of dollars in federal funding on immigration enforcement.

title: Crypto-Backed Stablecoin Bill Gets Bipartisan Push for Quick Revival in Senate
content: Senators in both parties are working to quickly revive stablecoin legislation backed by the crypto industry that faltered after a furor over President Donald Trump’s growing portfolio of lucrative crypto ventures.

title: Portugal Far-Right Leader Helped Off Stage After Feeling Unwell
content: Portugal’s far-right leader Andre Ventura was helped off the stage during a speech at a campaign dinner on Tuesday, sparking concerns about his health before a snap election due to take place on Sunday.

title: Trump’s Freebie Qatar Jet Is the Stuff of Nightmares in Spyworld
content: Qatar’s offer of a luxury Boeing 747 to President Donald Trump has set off alarm bells within the US intelligence and diplomatic community, where gifts from foreign powers have long been viewed with suspicion.

title: Trump Puts Dealmaking Over Rights in Saudi Arabia Policy Speech
content: President Donald Trump sent a message to the world in Saudi Arabia: make business deals and the US won’t meddle in your affairs.

title: Zelenskiy Stands By Plan to Meet Putin in Turkey for Talks
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy reinforced his intention to hold direct talks with Vladimir Putin in Turkey on Thursday, even though he said he had little hope that the Russian leader would show up.

content: Carlyle Group Inc is seeking about $1.2 billion in a syndicated loan to refinance debt used to acquire Mumbai-based software firm Hexaware Technologies Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Samsung to Buy FläktGroup for €1.5 Billion in Data Center Play
content: Samsung Electronics Co. has agreed to buy FläktGroup Holding GmbH for €1.5 billion ($1.7 billion), acquiring the European heating and cooling specialist in its biggest overseas takeover in eight years.

title: SoftBank Profit Doubles After ByteDance, Didi Values Surge
content: SoftBank Group Corp.’s profit soared 124% after valuations of tech startups like ByteDance Ltd. rose, in a boost for the Japanese company’s aggressive data center investment plans.

title: Nubank Shares Dip Post-Earnings as Funding Weighs on Margins

title: Trump’s Mideast Visit Opens Floodgate of AI Deals Led by Nvidia
content: The Trump administration is clearing a path for two key Persian Gulf allies to pursue their artificial intelligence ambitions — and some of the biggest US tech companies are seizing on that opening with plans to spend billions of dollars in the region.

title: Mobile Games Turn Into Boom-or-Bust Industry as Spending Rises
content: Mobile gamers ramped up their spending by 4% last year even as the number of downloads and new releases fell, highlighting the narrowing of the industry to a handful of huge titles that dominate users’ time.

title: Nvidia CEO Compensation Jumps to $50 Million After Stock Surge
content: The pay package of Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang jumped 46% to nearly $50 million in fiscal 2025 after the company he co-founded became the top beneficiary of an artificial intelligence spending boom.

title: Airbnb Revamps App With Luxury Services, Curated Tours in Push Beyond Stays
content: After more than a year of teasing expansion plans beyond home rentals, Airbnb Inc. launched an overhauled app that’s not just for homeowners and travelers, but also for personal chefs, hair stylists, trainers and tour operators to offer their services widely.

title: DeepSeek’s ‘Tech Madman’ Founder Is Threatening US Dominance in AI Race
content: The company’s sudden emergence illustrates how China’s industry is thriving despite Washington’s efforts to slow it down.

title: US Plans to Grant Saudi Arabia More Access to AI Chips | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Nvidia’s plans to sell advanced semiconductors to Humain for a massive data center project in Saudi Arabia. Plus, City Index Senior Analyst Fiona Cincotta explains why markets aren’t out of the woods yet. All this as US President Donald Trump and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman meet in Riyadh to announce new investments.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: S&P 500, Nasdaq 100 Erase 2025 Drop as Trade Hope Sparks Rebound
content: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 indexes turned higher for the year on Tuesday, reversing multi-trillion dollar routs, as enthusiasm for US stocks grows with global trade tensions cooling after the Trump administration and China agreed to temporarily lower tariffs.

title: Google Backs Saudi AI Fund as Trump, MBS Tout New Investments
content: Saudi Arabian venture capital firm STV launched a $100 million artificial intelligence fund with backing from Google as part of a package of deals announced during US President Donald Trump’s visit to the kingdom.

title: Milei Scraps Tariffs That Put $2,000 Price Tags on iPhones
content: President Javier Milei cut tariffs that made Argentina one of the most expensive places in the world to buy iPhones after decades of protectionist policies, delivering on a campaign promise to open up the economy to trade.

title: US Warns That Using Huawei AI Chip ‘Anywhere’ Breaks Its Rules
content: The Commerce Department issued guidance stating that the use of Huawei Technologies Co.’s Ascend artificial intelligence chips “anywhere in the world” violates the government’s export controls, escalating US efforts to curb technological advances in China.

title: Microsoft Is Cutting Thousands of Employees Across the Company
content: Microsoft Corp. said it will cut 6,000 workers across the company in an effort to reduce management layers.

title: Trump to Rewrite AI Chip Curbs Reviled by Nvidia and US Allies
content: The Trump administration plans to overhaul regulations on the export of semiconductors used in artificial intelligence, tossing out a Biden-era approach that had drawn strenuous objections from US allies and companies including Nvidia Corp. and Oracle Corp.

title: Top Asia Advisers at Morgan Stanley, UBS See China Revival
content: Two senior executives from Morgan Stanley and UBS Group AG who advise Asia’s ultra-wealthy are seeing renewed investor optimism over China following a weekend truce between the two largest economies.

title: Restaurant Tech Startup Owner.com Hits $1 Billion Valuation
content: Meritech and Headline co-led a $120 million funding around for the startup.

title: US Mulls Letting UAE Buy Over a Million Leading Nvidia Chips

title: Google Unveils Major Android Redesign Ahead of iPhone Overhaul

content: Humain, Saudi Arabia’s new artificial intelligence investment company, is teaming up with chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices Inc. to spend $10 billion on AI infrastructure over the next five years.

content: Ballooning property prices and rents are causing serious housing affordability problems in Australia. So how bad is it? And how did it get to this point?

title: Angola’s Fight Against Corruption Is Losing Momentum, IMF Says
content: Angolan President Joao Lourenco’s anti-corruption drive is losing steam, threatening the country’s economic growth outlook, according to the International Monetary Fund.

title: Wall Street Sees Higher China Growth, Less Stimulus on US Truce
content: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and other major banks boosted their forecasts for China’s 2025 economic growth, citing a better outlook for exports following the tariff truce with the US.

title: South Korean Think Tank Halves 2025 Growth Forecast to 0.8%
content: A South Korean state-funded think tank slashed its outlook for the country’s growth this year, reflecting the fallout from Donald Trump’s tariff campaign on the trade-reliant nation as its presidential race hits full swing.

title: Japan’s Key Trade Chiefs Skip Chance to Meet Greer at APEC
content: Japan’s Trade Minister Yoji Muto will skip a gathering of trade chiefs this week, a decision that will likely lower Tokyo’s chances of holding meaningful bilateral talks with US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer on the sidelines of the meeting.

title: Peru Prime Minister Resigns After Backlash From Cabinet Reshuffle
content: Peru’s prime minister resigned on Tuesday evening after a last-ditch attempt at a cabinet reshuffle did not placate opposition lawmakers who demanded his ouster.

title: Australian Wage Growth Quickens to 3.4% on Tight Jobs Market
content: Australia’s wage growth was stronger than expected in the first three months of the year, highlighting the nation’s tight labor market that has been underpinned by a wave of public-sector hiring.

title: China Surrounded Xi’s Aide With Seasoned Experts to Seal US Deal
content: China’s surprisingly quick agreement with the US to wind back punitive tariff rates put a spotlight on a Chinese negotiating team that features decades worth of technical trade experience alongside a top aide of President Xi Jinping.

title: New Zealand Saw Record Number of People Depart in March Year
content: A record number of people left New Zealand in the year through March, reducing the net gain through immigration to the lowest in more than two years.

title: Milei Scraps Tariffs That Put $2,000 Price Tags on iPhones
content: President Javier Milei cut tariffs that made Argentina one of the most expensive places in the world to buy iPhones after decades of protectionist policies, delivering on a campaign promise to open up the economy to trade.

title: Trump’s Global Tariffs Face Key Test in US Trade Court
content: A group of small businesses urged the US trade court to block President Donald Trump’s “Liberation Day” global tariffs during a court hearing that could have a major impact on the Republican’s economic agenda.

title: Trump Says Fed Must Lower Rates After Soft Inflation Report
content: President Donald Trump cited a softer-than-expected inflation report to again pressure Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell to lower interest rates.

title: Trump and MBS Tout $1 Trillion Pledge as Details Remain Elusive
content: President Donald Trump and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman touted a pledge for $1 trillion in commercial deals in Riyadh on Tuesday, a staggering figure that doesn’t quite stand up to scrutiny.

title: Cheaper Eggs, Pricier Car Rentals: A Look at US April Inflation
content: US inflation rose by less than expected in April, helped by steep declines in prices for sporting events, eggs and other groceries.

title: ECB’s Villeroy Says Another Rate Cut Is Likely by Summer
content: The European Central Bank will probably lower borrowing costs again by the summer as trade tensions aren’t fueling inflation in the region, Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.

title: Romania Raises €1.6 Billion in Local Debt Before Tight Vote
content: Romania sold more euro-denominated debt on the domestic market than planned, rushing to fill up state coffers ahead of a contentious presidential run-off that’s weighed on the the country’s assets.

title: Colombian Business Lobby Warns of Risks From a Deal With China
content: Colombia’s business lobby warned of risks to local industry from President Gustavo Petro’s plan to join the Chinese Belt and Road Initiative.

title: Student Loans Drive US Delinquency Rate to Highest Since 2020
content: The share of outstanding US consumer debt that’s in delinquency rose in the first quarter to the highest in five years, reflecting an end to the pandemic-era pause on reporting delinquent student loan payments on credit reports.

title: ECB’s Knot Sees Trade Curbing Inflation and Growth in Near Term
content: Uncertainty stemming from US trade policy is likely to curb inflation and economic growth in the near term, though its effects on prices are less clear beyond that, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Klaas Knot.

title: UK Taxpayers to Make Money on BOE Lending to Banks, Reeves Says
content: The Bank of England is expected to make a profit on the cash it provides high street lenders, a small consolation for UK taxpayers as losses on its flagship quantitative-easing program continue to mount.

title: Bulgarian President’s Proposal for Euro Referendum Blocked
content: Bulgaria’s parliament speaker dismissed an initiative by President Rumen Radev to hold a referendum on euro adoption as the nation moves closer to joining the single currency next year.

title: Poland’s Domanski Sees EU Defense Fund Agreement This Month
content: Polish Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski said he expects the European Union to reach a deal this month on a €150 billion ($167 billion) fund to boost the bloc’s defense capabilities.

title: Softer-Than-Expected Inflation Points to Muted Tariff Fallout
content: US inflation rose by less than forecast in April amid tame prices for clothing and new cars, suggesting little urgency so far by companies to pass along the cost of higher tariffs to consumers.

title: Here Are the Key Takeaways From the US CPI Report for April
content: Here are five key takeaways from today’s April US consumer price index report:

title: US Small-Business Optimism Declines for a Fourth Straight Month
content: Sentiment among US small businesses deteriorated for a fourth straight month in April as firms grew more downbeat about the economic outlook and sales prospects amid higher tariffs.

title: Brazil Central Bank Vows Tight Monetary Policy for Prolonged Period
content: Brazil’s central bank sees the need for tighter monetary policy for a longer period due to unanchored inflation forecasts, according to the minutes to the last interest rate decision published on Tuesday.

title: Bessent Says EU Is Plagued by ‘Collective Action Problem’
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the European Union suffers from a “collective action problem” that’s hampering trade negotiations, downplaying the possibility of a quick agreement with the US’s largest trading relationship.

title: India Proposes First Counter Move Against Trump’s Tariff Regime
content: India has proposed levies on some US goods in response to Washington’s duties on steel and aluminum, marking its first retaliation against President Donald Trump’s tariff regime, even as the two countries move closer to finalizing a trade deal.

title: Burberry to Cut Almost a Fifth of Workforce as Sales Drop
content: Burberry Group Plc plans to cut almost one-fifth of its work force as its new chief executive officer tries to turn around the British trench-coat maker, after its push into high fashion flopped amid a downturn in global demand for luxury goods.

title: Aviva’s £3.7 Billion Direct Line Deal Faces UK Merger Review
content: Aviva Plc faces a review by the UK’s merger watchdog into its plan to buy Direct Line Insurance Group Plc for roughly £3.7 billion ($4.9 billion) in a deal that would create the UK’s largest motor insurer.

title: Imperial Brands CEO to Retire After Push to Drive Tobacco Sales
content: Imperial Brands Plc Chief Executive Officer Stefan Bomhard is to retire after five years in charge of the British tobacco maker, which turned its focus back to cigarettes and boosted shareholder returns on his watch.

title: GSK to Buy Liver Disease Drug for as Much as $2 Billion
content: GSK Plc agreed to buy an experimental medicine to treat liver disease for as much as $2 billion as the UK drugmaker seeks to shore up its pipeline of new medicines.

title: Trump Favors $40-$50 Oil, Goldman Says After Sifting Posts
content: President Donald Trump appears to prefer US oil prices between $40 and $50 a barrel, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc., citing an in-house analysis of his social-media posts on the topic.

title: Daimler Truck Cuts Guidance, Citing North America Uncertainty
content: Daimler Truck Holding AG lowered its sales and profit guidance for the year, citing increasing economic uncertainty in North America due to trade tensions in the region.

title: EON Says Grid Investments Drove First-Quarter Earnings Jump
content: EON SE’s earnings jumped in the first quarter as the German energy company continues to focus investments on power grids and benefit from the region’s energy transition.

title: Bad Trader Behavior, Short-Sale Breaches Stalk Australian Banks
content: Australia’s finance industry is beset by a raft of compliance lapses — from data reporting breaches to trader misbehavior — reigniting concerns the $541 billion sector has struggled to clean up after a litany of scandals came to light six years ago.

title: Nissan Shares Fall on Annual Loss, Withheld Profit Outlook
content: Nissan Motor Co. shares fell after the Japanese automaker posted an annual net loss of ¥670.9 billion ($4.5 billion) and decided against issuing an operating profit forecast for the current fiscal year.

title: Millennium Hires Ex-UBS Asia-Pacific Equity Derivatives Head
content: Millennium Management hired UBS Group AG’s former equity derivatives head for Asia-Pacific, the latest move by the $73 billion investment giant to tap investment bank executives for expansion.

title: VietJet Set for Financial Reckoning as Court Denies Payment Stay
content: A London High Court has refused VietJet Aviation JSC’s application for a stay and ruled the Vietnamese carrier must pay around $180 million to an aircraft leasing firm starting this week, bringing to a head a years-long legal dispute that started during the Covid-19 pandemic

title: Taiwan Opens Door to Restart Atomic Power Plants in Reversal
content: Taiwanese lawmakers revised a nuclear power bill that effectively opens the door for a restart of the island’s atomic plants, underscoring a wider policy shift as its energy demand grows and geopolitical tensions worsen.

title: Barclays Picks Avinash Thakur to Head Investment Banking in Asia Pacific
content: Barclays Plc has named Avinash Thakur as head of investment banking for Asia Pacific, replacing Vanessa Koo, who is retiring.

title: Nubank Shares Dip Post-Earnings as Funding Weighs on Margins
content: Shares of Nu Holdings Ltd. fell after reporting first quarter results that showed strong revenue growth weighed down by higher spending to attract new clients and protect against potential bad loans.

title: Harvard Expands Lawsuit Against US as Funding Feud Deepens
content: Harvard University expanded its lawsuit Tuesday against the Trump administration for freezing billions of dollars in federal funds, ratcheting up the high-stakes legal battle between the wealthiest US university and the White House.

title: UK Watchdog Set to Ease Insurance Rules for Large Companies
content: The UK markets watchdog is planning to pare its rules on how insurers can sell policies to large companies, the latest signal regulators are pivoting to a more pragmatic stance that leans heavily into the government’s growth agenda.

title: State Farm Wins 17% Emergency Rate Hike for Homes After LA Fires
content: State Farm has been approved for an emergency 17% rate increase on homeowner insurance policies in California, part of an effort to shore up the state’s largest insurer after the devastating wildfires in the Los Angeles area.

title: B. Riley Overshoots Another Deadline for Filing Results With SEC
content: B. Riley Financial Inc. added to its tally of overdue regulatory filings, this time missing the deadline for quarterly results as soured investments mounted.

title: Promoters of $100 Million NJ Deli Get Prison Time for Fraud
content: A father and son who participated in a scheme to inflate the value of a New Jersey deli to more than $100 million each received prison time for their roles in the fraud.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs’ Ex-Girlfriend Recounts ‘Freak-Offs’ and Fear
content: Sean “Diddy” Combs’ ex-girlfriend, Cassandra “Cassie” Ventura, told jurors she agreed to days-long drug-fueled sex parties during her decade-long relationship with Combs because she feared his violence, but also because she wanted to make him happy.

title: UnitedHealth Replaces CEO as Its Medicare Strategy Sputters
content: UnitedHealth Group Inc. unexpectedly replaced its chief executive and suspended earnings guidance, raising increasing questions over how the company once regarded as a safe bet by investors has got its cost predictions so wrong.

title: Arbor Realty Bundles Rental Loans in Its First CLO Deal Since 2022
content: Arbor Realty Trust Inc. is returning to securitization markets for the first time in three years as it looks to package up loans secured by apartment rental properties.

title: American Eagle Withdraws 2025 Outlook After Weak First Quarter
content: American Eagle Outfitters Inc.’s stock dropped after it pulled its guidance for the full year following a first quarter that was marred by discounting and a write-down of inventory.

title: China Birth Rate Plans Boost New Zealand’s Top-Performing Stock
content: China’s plans to lift its birth rate have helped a2 Milk Co.’s stock become the biggest gainer in New Zealand this year.

title: CFPB Drops Biden-Era Lawsuit Against Walmart, Fintech Partner
content: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau dropped its lawsuit against Walmart Inc. and one of its financial-technology partners, the latest of the agency’s Biden-era enforcement actions to be abandoned by President Donald Trump’s administration.

title: Southwest Air Hints at International Expansion in DOT Filing
content: Southwest Airlines Co. has filed with the US Transportation Department for authority to fly to any country with which the US has an Open Skies aviation agreement, signaling the carrier intends to expand its small international route network.

title: Goldman in Talks to Expand Marcus Retail Bank Into Ireland
content: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has held talks with regulators about an Irish launch of its retail bank Marcus, a move that could shake up the country’s heavily concentrated market and give the Wall Street giant access to tens of billions of euros in deposits.

title: Starbucks Baristas Strike Over Dress Code, Signal More Walkouts
content: Hundreds of Starbucks Corp. employees have walked off the job since Sunday to protest the company’s new dress code, according to the union representing baristas, with more strikes likely in the coming days.

title: NYC Ordered to Hand Control of Rikers Jail to Outside Manager
content: A federal judge ordered New York City to hand control of its troubled Rikers Island jail to an outside manager, capping a decade-long court-ordered monitorship that consistently found rampant violence and other ills in the city’s lockups.

title: Paul Allen’s Estate Puts NBA’s Portland Trail Blazers Up for Sale
content: The NBA has yet another team on the market, with the Portland Trail Blazers being put up for sale by the estate of Paul Allen, the Microsoft Corp. co-founder.

title: Man from Moldova accused in credit card fraud scheme
content: A man wanted in his home country of Moldova was found to be in unlawful possession of 131 credit cards that didn't match his identity following a traffic stop on the Indiana Toll Road in Porter County this past weekend.

title: “Dagestani Achilles Heel” Given Credit For Jack Della Maddalena’s Win Over Belal Muhammad at UFC 315
content: Jack Della Maddalena's coach gets huge praise from a former UFC heavyweight who labeled him the "Dagestani Achilles Heel".

title: Student loan collections resume, credit scores tumble: NY Fed
content: Millions of borrowers who are late on their student loan payments now face "grave consequences" as collection activity restarts, the New York Fed says.

title: Americans’ credit card debt falls, but past-due student loans drag on credit scores
content: Americans tidied up their household balance sheets to start 2025, cleaning up some credit card and auto loan debt, new data showed Tuesday.

title: Rain helps increase Carolina Forest wildfire containment to 93%
content: Officials with the South Carolina Forestry Commission credit recent rain for an increase in containment of the Carolina Forest wildfire.

title: Marks & Spencer confirms customers' personal data was stolen in hack
content: A ransomware gang reportedly took credit for the data breach.

title: Donald Trump Claims Credit for the Election of Pope Leo XIV-Despite Having No Ties to the Vatican Papal Conclave
content: Donald Trump has suggested that he indeed played a role in Pope Leo XIV's election. No, it's not about whether he had something to do with the papal conclave, but rather his big win among the Catholic voters in America.

title: Six accessories I would buy with my exclusive PhoneArena Galaxy S25 Edge pre-order credit
content: PhoneArena readers can save $50 on eligible accessories when they pre-order the Galaxy S25 Edge. Check out the six accessories I would buy with my credit

title: Pay off credit card debt: Woman shares how a nonprofit helped her
content: After a break up led a Massachusetts woman into $20,000 of credit card debt, she has independence, thanks to the help of a nonprofit. Here's her story.

title: How much does credit counseling cost?
content: Worried about the cost of credit counseling? Here's what you'll really pay — and how it compares to other options.

title: SEC’s Anti-Fraud Public Service Campaign Warns Investors About Relationship Investment Scams
content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will hold four more roundtables in its ongoing series discussing crypto asset regulation.

content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

content:

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the members of the Crypto Task Force staff, which is advising the Commission on matters related to crypto.

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: DFJ Growth Closes $1.2B Flagship Fund
content: Venture investor DFJ Growth announced it has raised $1.2 billion for a fifth flagship fund, its largest to date.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
